results.title: Targeting autophagy in autoimmune glomerular diseases.
results.text_hl: Drugs that improve mitochondrial function or enhance autophagy, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@sodium-glucose co-transporter 2@@@ (@GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@SGLT2@@@) inhibitors or @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ inhibitors, may exert protective effects on podocytes and reduce @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ in @DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@MN@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulosclerosis_Focal_Segmental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005923 @@@focal segmental glomerulosclerosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Glomerulosclerosis_Focal_Segmental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005923 @@@FSGS@@@).

citations.NLM: Claudio P, Gabriella M. Targeting autophagy in autoimmune glomerular diseases. J Nephrol. 2025 Mar 19;():. PMID: 40106213
